alert.note: Alert for Arlington, Falls Church, Alexandria; Central and Southeast Prince William, Manassas, Manassas Park; Eastern Loudoun; Fairfax; Northern Fauquier; Northwest Prince William; Rappahannock; Western Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 31 at 11:48AM EDT until April 02 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern Maryland, The District of Columbia, and northern Virginia. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are most likely late Saturday afternoon through mid Saturday evening.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
